intro: Micromeria chionistrae, commonly known as the snow-lace plant, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in clusters, often in shades of white and pink. It thrives in alpine environments, where it adapts to cold temperatures and high altitudes. Its foliage is typically covered in fine hairs, which help to retain moisture and protect against harsh weather conditions.
